1. #sabainsight18 GET STUFF DONE Silviu Nedea, HRIT Delivery Lead DXC Technology Talent Supply and Demand: Saba as the Gold Source for Skills at DXC

2. #sabainsight18 About the speaker SILVIU NEDEA Silviu Nedea is an award-winning HRIT leader with over 10 years experience using Saba. He has a demonstrated track record of driving change and transformation within HR and Payroll IT at DXC Technology, the world’s largest pure-play IT services company, and global Fortune 50 corporations. Silviu relishes any opportunity to take on – and complete – challenges that once seemed impossible to others. There is always another way to get stuff done. He feels honored to have had the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of millions of people around the globe using Saba. And he’s not done yet! In his spare time, Silviu enjoys reading and traveling and lives in Houston, Texas, with his wife, daughter and two cats.

21. © 2018 SABA SOFTWARE, INC. 21#sabainsight18 DXC skill name New description Drones A drone, or unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV), is an aircraft without a human pilot aboard. Robots A robot is a machine—especially one programmable by a computer— capable of carrying out a complex series of actions automatically. 3D Printing 3D printing refers to processes in which material is joined or solidified under computer control to create a three-dimensional object, with material being added together (such as liquid molecules or powder grains being fused together). Computer Vision Computer vision is an interdisciplinary field that deals with how computers can be made for gaining high-level understanding from digital images or videos. Computer Voice Computer voice is an interdisciplinary field that deals with how computers can be made for synthesis and recognition of human voice, including to create virtual assistants (software agents that can perform tasks or services for an individual) like Amazon Alexa, Microsoft Cortana, Google Assistant, and others. Artificial Intelligence (AI) Artificial intelligence (AI, also machine intelligence, MI) is intelligence displayed by machines, in contrast with the natural intelligence (NI) displayed by humans and other animals. Machine Learning (ML) Machine learning is a field of computer science that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed. Chatbots A chatbot (also known as a talkbot, chatterbot, Bot, IM bot, interactive agent, or Artificial Conversational Entity) is a computer program which conducts a conversation via auditory or textual methods. Augmented Reality (AR) Augmented reality (AR) is a live direct or indirect view of a physical, real-world environment whose elements are "augmented" by computer- generated perceptual information, ideally across multiple sensory modalities, including visual, auditory, haptic, somatosensory, and olfactory. Virtual Reality (VR) Virtual reality (VR) is a computer-generated scenario that simulates a realistic experience. The immersive environment can be similar to the real world in order to create a lifelike experience grounded in reality or sci-fi. Internet of Things (IoT) The Internet of things (IoT) is the network of physical devices, vehicles, home appliances and other items embedded with electronics, software, sensors, actuators, and connectivity which enables these objects to connect and exchange data. Blockchain A blockchain is a continuously growing list of records, called blocks, which are linked and secured using cryptography. Quantum Computing Quantum computing is computing using quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement. Labs category and skills
